oai_dc:dc.dc:title: French. Lizzie Crozier French Scrapbook, p. 32 d
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Lizzie Crozier French Scrapbook, p. 32 d. Newspaper clipping: 'Equal Suffrage association and Knoxville Equal Suffrage league.'
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Politics & government; Clippings; Scrapbooks; Women; Women's suffrage;
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: C.M. McClung Historical Collection, Knox County Public Library
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: For information on license and use fees and acquiring high-resolution image files, contact DigitalCollections@knoxlib.org or phone 865 215-8814. Please provide a brief description of the material.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Equal Suffrage association and Knoxville Equal Suffrage league. Being 21 years old, we object to being classed with minors. Born in America, and loyal to her institutions, we protest against being made perpetual aliens. Costing the treasuries of our counties nothing, we protest against acknowledging the male pauper as our political superior. Being obedient to the law. we protest against the statute which classes us with the convict, and makes the pardoned criminal our political superior. Being sane, we object to being classed with the lunatic. Possessed of an average amount of intelligence, we protest against legal classification with the idiot. We taxpayers claim the right to representation. We married women want to own our own clothes. We married breadwinners want to own our own earnings. We mothers want an equal partnership in our children. We educated women want the power to offset the illiterate vote of our state. Women who object to being thus classed, and men who object to thus classing mothers, sisters, wives and daughters, are urged to join the Knoxville Equal Suffrage league and help to obtain a higher classification.
